parameters.name: WorkflowId
parameters.description: A unique identifier for the workflow.

nested_items.name: Arn
nested_items.description: Specifies the unique Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the workflow.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: Specifies the text description for the workflow.

nested_items.name: Steps
nested_items.description: Specifies the details for the steps that are in the specified workflow.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: Currently, the following step types are supported.
COPY - Copy the file to another location.
CUSTOM - Perform a custom step with an Lambda function target.
DECRYPT - Decrypt a file that was encrypted before it was uploaded.
DELETE - Delete the file.
TAG - Add a tag to the file.

nested_items.name: CopyStepDetails
nested_items.description: Details for a step that performs a file copy.
A description.
An Amazon S3 location for the destination of the file copy.
A flag that indicates whether to overwrite an existing file of the same name. The default is FALSE.

nested_items.name: CustomStepDetails
nested_items.description: Details for a step that invokes an Lambda function.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the step, used as an identifier.

nested_items.name: Target
nested_items.description: The ARN for the Lambda function that is being called.

nested_items.name: TimeoutSeconds
nested_items.description: Timeout, in seconds, for the step.

nested_items.name: SourceFileLocation
nested_items.description: Specifies which file to use as input to the workflow step: either the output from the previous step, or the originally uploaded file for the workflow.
To use the previous file as the input, enter ${previous.file}. In this case, this workflow step uses the output file from the previous workflow step as input. This is the default value.
To use the originally uploaded file location as input for this step, enter ${original.file}.

nested_items.name: DeleteStepDetails
nested_items.description: Details for a step that deletes the file.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the step, used as an identifier.

nested_items.name: SourceFileLocation
nested_items.description: Specifies which file to use as input to the workflow step: either the output from the previous step, or the originally uploaded file for the workflow.
To use the previous file as the input, enter ${previous.file}. In this case, this workflow step uses the output file from the previous workflow step as input. This is the default value.
To use the originally uploaded file location as input for this step, enter ${original.file}.

nested_items.name: TagStepDetails
nested_items.description: Details for a step that creates one or more tags.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the step, used as an identifier.

nested_items.name: Tags
nested_items.description: Array that contains from 1 to 10 key/value pairs.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The name assigned to the tag that you create.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The value that corresponds to the key.

nested_items.name: SourceFileLocation
nested_items.description: Specifies which file to use as input to the workflow step: either the output from the previous step, or the originally uploaded file for the workflow.
To use the previous file as the input, enter ${previous.file}. In this case, this workflow step uses the output file from the previous workflow step as input. This is the default value.
To use the originally uploaded file location as input for this step, enter ${original.file}.

nested_items.name: DecryptStepDetails
nested_items.description: Details for a step that decrypts an encrypted file.
A descriptive name.
An Amazon S3 or Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS) location for the source file to decrypt.
An S3 or Amazon EFS location for the destination of the file decryption.
A flag that indicates whether to overwrite an existing file of the same name. The default is FALSE.
The type of encryption that's used. Currently, only PGP encryption is supported.

nested_items.name: OnExceptionSteps
nested_items.description: Specifies the steps (actions) to take if errors are encountered during execution of the workflow.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: Currently, the following step types are supported.
COPY - Copy the file to another location.
CUSTOM - Perform a custom step with an Lambda function target.
DECRYPT - Decrypt a file that was encrypted before it was uploaded.
DELETE - Delete the file.
TAG - Add a tag to the file.

nested_items.name: DecryptStepDetails
nested_items.description: Details for a step that decrypts an encrypted file.
A descriptive name.
An Amazon S3 or Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS) location for the source file to decrypt.
An S3 or Amazon EFS location for the destination of the file decryption.
A flag that indicates whether to overwrite an existing file of the same name. The default is FALSE.
The type of encryption that's used. Currently, only PGP encryption is supported.

nested_items.name: WorkflowId
nested_items.description: A unique identifier for the workflow.

nested_items.name: Tags
nested_items.description: Key-value pairs that can be used to group and search for workflows. Tags are metadata attached to workflows for any purpose.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The name assigned to the tag that you create.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: Contains one or more values that you assigned to the key name you create.
